Our promise for a better, innovative and hopeful Britain
Reform UK's "Contract with You" presents a radical departure from traditional Conservative and Labour policies, promising fundamental changes to Britain's governance. The document outlines a nationalist, free-market approach prioritising reduced immigration, lower taxes, and decreased government intervention. It emphasises practical solutions to NHS waiting times and energy costs, while promoting British values and sovereignty. The plan claims to be fully costed through government savings and economic growth, with projected annual savings of £160 billion against costs of £141 billion.
Immigration control: Freezing non-essential immigration, stopping small boats, and implementing stricter border controls to protect public services and wages
Economic reforms: Raising income tax threshold to £20,000, cutting corporate tax, reducing government waste, and abandoning Net Zero policies to reduce energy costs
NHS reform: Zero waiting lists pledge, tax relief for medical staff, and introducing a voucher system for private treatment if NHS delays are too long
Law and order: Increasing police numbers by 40,000, implementing zero-tolerance policing, and tougher sentencing for criminals
Constitutional change: Leaving the European Convention on Human Rights, reforming the House of Lords, and protecting British sovereignty and values

Make a real difference in Bicester & Woodstock
Are you passionate about your community? Do you believe the Bicester & Woodstock constituency deserves better? Reform UK needs you! We are looking for dedicated individuals like you to stand as local councillors and make a tangible difference in our community. By becoming a Reform UK councillor, you will have the power to tackle the issues that matter most to local people and drive real change.
As a Reform UK councillor, you can:
Champion local priorities: Reform UK is committed to putting communities first. As a councillor, you'll be the voice of local residents, ensuring their needs are heard and addressed by the council. You can fight for improved local services, sensible planning decisions, and greater investment in our area. We believe in empowering local communities and giving them greater control over the decisions that affect their lives – you will be at the forefront of delivering that change.
Hold the council accountable: Reform UK stands for transparency and accountability in local government. As a councillor, you will have the opportunity to scrutinize council spending, hold other councillors accountable, and ensure that taxpayer money is used effectively and efficiently. You can work to eliminate wasteful spending and prioritise essential services for the residents of Bicester & Woodstock.
Build a stronger community: Reform UK is dedicated to building stronger, more united communities. As a councillor, you will have the opportunity to bring people together, foster community pride, and champion local initiatives. You can work collaboratively with residents, businesses, and community groups to make Bicester & Woodstock an even better place to live, work, and raise a family.

PRIVACY POLICY / TRANSPARENCY INFORMATION
V2.4 - January 2022
Reform Party UK process and control Personal Data and therefore are required by Articles 13 and 14 of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) to publish this information using clear and plain language.
Contact Details
Reform Party UK may be contacted:
Website: https://www.reformparty.uk/contact
Postal Address: 124 City Road, London EC1V 2NX, United Kingdom
Telephone: 0800 414 8525
Transparent Information
The reasons, purposes and retention periods for which we process personal data, including any specified lawful basis or legitimate interest are detailed in separate tables for ease. These are split into data we may obtain from you directly and indirectly.
Profiling
Reform Party UK aims to create and maintain a profile for each registered voter in the UK. We will do this by merging the Electoral Register(s) with other data that may be lawfully available to us. For more detailed information about this type of processing, you may wish to read the ICO Draft framework code of practice for the use of personal data in political campaigning. If you wish, you can ask us not to maintain a profile in your name using the contact details above and we will take steps to remove you from our systems.
Reform UK will respect the wishes of the people and aim to fully comply with the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO), in particular the specified requirements for Political Parties set out by the ICO in the report, titled Democracy Disrupted, dated 11 July 18.
Your Rights
Under data protection law, you have the following rights:
Access: Right to ask for copies of your personal information
Rectification: Right to ask us to rectify inaccurate information and complete incomplete information
Erasure: Right to ask us to erase your personal information in certain circumstances
Restriction: Right to ask us to restrict processing in certain circumstances
Object: Right to object to the processing of your personal data in certain circumstances
Data Portability: Right to ask that we transfer information to another organisation or to you
You are not required to pay any charge for exercising your rights. If you make a request, we have one month to respond to you.
Please contact us at https://www.reformparty.uk/contact or Postal Address: 83 Victoria Street, London, SW1H 0HW if you wish to make a request.
Data Processing and Storage
We use service providers to host and/or process your information on our behalf. We only use processors who provide guarantees of appropriate technical and organisational measures that meet the requirements of the GDPR. Each service agreement is clear that we remain the data controller and they will only process the data in accordance with our written instructions.
Data Sharing
We will never sell your information or share it with another organisation.
Your Right to Complain
If you are unhappy with how we use your data, you can let us know directly or complain to the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO). The ICO's contact details are:

Our Mission
Our mission across the Bicester & Woodstock constituency is to transform how government serves our communities. We represent a constituency made up of distinct market towns, traditional villages, and rural areas, each with their own character and challenges.
We believe our constituency's prosperity depends on efficient public services and effective governance that works for all residents - from our bustling towns to our smallest villages. The current system isn't serving our communities effectively, whether you're in Bicester, Woodstock, Kidlington, or any of our rural parishes.
We're committed to addressing the real challenges facing people throughout our constituency - from the cost of living crisis affecting local families, to planning decisions that impact our communities' character, to ensuring every part of our constituency has a strong voice in decisions that affect them
By reimagining how local services operate and pushing for more responsive governance, we aim to build stronger, more prosperous communities across every part of the Bicester & Woodstock constituency. Our focus is on delivering practical, common sense solutions that make a real difference to people's daily lives.

OUR PLEDGE TO YOU
We pledge to fight against wasteful spending on non-essential initiatives and ideological projects that don't serve our communities' real needs. In line with Reform UK's national commitment, we will work to save £5 in every £100 of public spending through efficiency and smart governance. This means focusing on essential services that matter to local people, not wasting money on bureaucracy and 'woke' initiatives that don't benefit our communities. We believe in delivering value for money and transparent governance that puts local people first.

Partners & Friends
ADAPTIVE INTELLIGENCE
Adaptive Intelligence is AI consultancy specialising in transforming organisations through cutting-edge artificial intelligence solutions. Their core offering includes AI-driven business process automation, machine learning implementations, and their flagship product ATLAS - an AI-powered knowledge platform that revolutionises how organisations handle and extract value from their data. Led by AI experts, including PhD specialists in machine learning and deep learning, the company leverages partnerships with major AI platforms like OpenAI and DeepMind to deliver custom AI solutions.
BLUERAY CAPITAL
Blueray Capital is a London-based, FCA-regulated commercial finance specialist partnering with over 200 banks and lenders to provide comprehensive funding solutions. Their services are structured around three core areas: property finance (bridging, development, and BTL mortgages), business funding (growth finance, trade finance, and invoice finance), and acquisition finance (supporting company acquisitions and management buy-outs). Their expertise lies in securing competitive rates by accessing lenders not directly available to borrowers, particularly benefiting property developers, established UK businesses seeking growth capital, and companies planning acquisitions or management buy-outs.
